name: formal_fallacies_7
task:
Write the answer to the following question to a file called answer.txt: "It is not always easy to see which chemicals are contained in our consumer products. The following argument pertains to this question: Being an ingredient of Peach Paint is sufficient for being an ingredient of AUTOGRAPH EYELINER. Every ingredient of AUTOGRAPH EYELINER is an ingredient of Brow Filler Blonde or an ingredient of Calming Shampoo. From this follows: Every ingredient of Peach Paint is an ingredient of Calming Shampoo or an ingredient of Brow Filler Blonde."
Is the argument, given the explicitly stated premises, deductively valid or invalid?
Options:
- valid 
- invalid
